results.title: Memory of Moholy-Nagy
results.brief_description: An digitally animated journey through the abstract colors, compositions, and constructions of the Hungarian artist Laszlo Moholy-Nagy. Using 3D animation tools, the artist has created a landscape of the mind of this important 20th century artist.
results.description: An digitally animated journey through the abstract colors, compositions, and constructions of the Hungarian artist Laszlo Moholy-Nagy. Using 3D animation tools, the artist has created a landscape of the mind of this important 20th century artist.

results.title: Memory of Christmas: from 'Act One' by Moss Hart
results.brief_description: A series of dramatic photographs illustrates playwright Moss Hart’s grievously impoverished childhood. The text, adapted from Hart’s autobiography “Act one” describes two Christmases a generation apart illustrating the gap that existed between himself and his father and how that gap was finally bridged.
results.title_for_label: Memory of Christmas: from ‘Act One’ by Moss Hart
results.description: A series of dramatic photographs illustrates playwright Moss Hart’s grievously impoverished childhood. results.title: Memory lingers on (Episode 4)
results.brief_description: Illustrates some of the latest research into the workings of the brain. Examines the memory capacity of the brain and probes such questions as “Does memory remain the same over the years?”, “How does memory influence everyday actions”, and “Is the script for the future already written - from memory?” Also gives details of how external stimuli are processed by the brain.
results.description: Illustrates some of the latest research into the workings of the brain. results.title: Memory lingers on
results.creator_credit: Colleen Johnson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Whether its in the eyes of her grandchild or the photos and memories of those loved and lost, Colleen Johnson feels a deep connection to her family. No matter what, they are her heart and soul.

results.title: Memory Grid MAP Project and Collection submissions 2003
results.brief_description: Three short documentary films containing personal stories of memory and place, featuring interviews and a montage of images through the use of paintings and photographs. Focuses on the themes of isolation, multiculturalism and the migrant experience, and dreams of past and the future.

results.title: Memory Grid MAP Project and Collection submissions 2002
results.brief_description: A collection of audiovisual works that capture the unique “memory” of a place. In particular, screen based works that tell a personal story about a place, have a narrative that relates to the location or are collaborative projects from a community group in an area.
